choices.name: Get started with research for your Alaska ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Alaska ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Alaska research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Alaska research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Alaska Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Alaska research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Alaska Overview—3:55 - 2018

  3. Follow this research study for Alaska ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Alaska Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Alaska research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Alaska Resources
    ☆ AC—Alaska State Research Guide - 2016

  5. Read the genealogy guide to Alaska research by Barb Snow.

    ☆ Alaska Genealogy Research Guide

  6. Record Finder: Use the Alaska Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Alaska Record Selection Table

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Alaska in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Alaska

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Alaska.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Alaska in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Alaska

    Exercises
    • * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
    • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.



Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Alaska in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Alaska

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Alaska.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Alaska in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Alaska

choices.name: Learn about Alaska archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alaska archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alaska Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Alaska State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the Alaska Digital Archives site.
  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Alaska.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Alaska genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

choices.name: Learn about Alaska city directories.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Alaska ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alaska city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alaska Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Alaska city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.- 2012

  4. Explore Alaska city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Alaska ☆historical directories by county.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Alaska Birth Records
    ☆ AC—Alaska Vital Records

  2. Explore additional links for Alaska birth records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  3. Explore links for vital records on the Alaska Division of Public Health site.
  4. Search for online Alaska ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  5. Explore Alaska birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  6. Explore additional links for Alaska vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site (scroll down).

QUIKLinks

  2. Explore links for Alaska marriage records.

choices.name: Record Finder

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

choices.name: Explore additional record collections.

content.text:
1. In FamilySearch, explore the Alaska Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Alaska Web Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Alaska Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Alaska Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Alaska.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Alaska research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Alaska research.
  2. Explore the Alaska research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Alaska research.

choices.name: Learn about Alaska genealogy and historic societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Alaska in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alaska Societies

  2. Explore the Alaska Historical Society site.
  3. Explore Alaska genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Alaska.
  5. Visit Alaska Genealogy - Just Ask!
